treatment.etymology: [Greek cerato, horned, and pteris, fern, referring to the antlerlike fertile leaf]
treatment.description: Plants 2--120 cm. Stems 1--10 mm diam., sparsely scaly. Leaves erect. Proximal leaves broad, simple and lobed to 4-pinnate, glabrous; distal leaves finely dissected with linear ultimate segments. Sporangia nearly sessile, usually densely packed, globose. Spores tetrahedral.

key_statement.statement: Sterile leaves simple, palmately or pinnately lobed, sometimes 2--4-pinnate, deltate to cordate to ovate; proximal pinnae or veins of lobes usually opposite; petioles frequently inflated. Fertile leaves usually deltate to cordate to reniform; sporangia lacking annulus or annulus well developed, indurate cells 0--10(--40).

Sterile leaves (1--)2--3-pinnate, lanceolate, lance-ovate, ovate to deltate; proximal pinnae usually alternate; petioles usually not inflated. Fertile leaves lanceolate, sometimes ovate, deltate, or cordate; sporangia with well-developed annulus, indurate cells 13--71.
